Windows NT: Yes (installable drivers for Windows XP  2003. Included with Windows Vista SP1 and newer.)
Linux: Yes (available as a kernel module or FUSE driver)

DOS: Yes (FAT16 from DOS 3.0  FAT16B from DOS 3.31  FAT16X from DOS 7.0)
Minix: Partial (via dosdir  dosread  doswrite  not FAT16X)

Windows 9x: Yes (with 3rd-party drivers like Paragon NTFS for Win98  DiskInternals NTFS Reader)
macOS: Yes natively read only  write support with Paragon NTFS or ntfs-3g
No write support since Mac OS X 10.6 and no support at all since macOS 10.15

Linux: Partial - writing support only to unjournalled FS
Yes - until 2.1.20 Experimental port available to 2.6.32 and later [80][81]

Windows NT: Yes with Paragon ExtFS [82] or partial with Ext2 IFS[83] or ext2fsd[84]
macOS: Yes with Paragon ExtFS [85] or ext2fsx

Windows NT: Yes with Paragon ExtFS [82] or partial with Ext2 IFS[83] or ext2fsd[84]
macOS: Yes with Paragon ExtFS [85] or partial with ext2fsx (journal not updated on writing)

Windows NT: Yes with Paragon ExtFS [82] or partial with Ext2 IFS[83] or ext2fsd[84]
FreeBSD: Partial support in kernel since version 10.1 (read-only)[86][87]

Linux: Yes as an external kernel module

FreeBSD: Partial - Read Only from 6.0 to 10.x[89] and dropped in 11.0[90][91]

Linux: Yes with FUSE[94] or as an external kernel module[95]

Windows NT: Yes (from Windows Server 2012 and from Windows 8.1)
Linux: Partial - with Paragon ReFS for Linux

Windows NT: Partial (There are ports of unsquashfs and mksquashfs.)
macOS: Partial (There are ports of unsquashfs and mksquashfs.)
FreeBSD: Partial (There are ports of unsquashfs and mksquashfs and fusefs-port.[98][99])
